article.title: Ly$α$ profile, dust, and prediction of Ly$α$ escape fraction in Green Pea Galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red square represent in Figure 1?
choices: Green Pea galaxies with low dust extinction
Confirmed Lyman-continuum leakers
Lyman-break analog galaxies
Galaxies with new HST observations

multiple_choice_question.text: How are the images in Figure 2 sorted?
choices: By increasing dust extinction from left to right and top to bottom
By decreasing metallicity from left to right and top to bottom
By decreasing Lya escape fraction from left to right and top to bottom
By increasing stellar mass from left to right and top to bottom

multiple_choice_question.text: Which sample has a similar cumulative EW(Lya) distribution to the Green Peas with EW(Lya) ≥ 20Å?
choices: z = 5.7 and 6.5 LAE
z = 2.8 LAE
GALEX z ~ 0.3 LAE
All of the above

multiple_choice_question.text: What correlation does f<sub>esc</sub>(Lya) show with all four kinematic features: V(blue-peak), V(red-peak), peak separation, and FWHM(red)?
choices: Positive correlation
No correlation
Anti-correlation
The correlation varies depending on the feature.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this equation represent: log(f<sub>esc</sub>(Lya)) = -0.545 × (FWHM(red)/100km/s) + 0.563
choices: The relation between Lya escape fraction and dust extinction
The relation between Lya escape fraction and the FWHM of the red portion of the Lya profile
The relation between Lya escape fraction and metallicity
The relation between Lya escape fraction and HI column density
